page.title: 18LANGLEYBURY COMP'VE SCHOOL
page.content: {KITCHEN STAFF} Some of the kitchen staff were interviewed by first year pupils. There are twelve cooks and they each take turns doing different jobs - cakes one week, washing-up the next etc. It takes three and a half hours to prepare the school dinners. Recently, a new self-service cafeteria system was introduced. The cooks felt it was a much better and quicker system. It means the pupils have a wider choice of food and do not have to queue for so long. The head cook has been at the school for six years, most of the others for only one year. They work from 8.30a.m. to 3p.m. and daily takings average Â£150, each pupil paying 65p for a meal. As the school is in an isolated position with no shops nearby, most of the pupils eat school dinners - especially in the winter.
